text:
Without a single thought of Kubla Khan or the sound, illustrious Buddha, I’ve sat at the edge of many rivers.

Some, I cannot recall without an Insect buzz, a stinging ant. Some, I cannot recall without A longing that blurs With the ease of eyes Falling blind.

In others still, I cannot recall myself – I grow wild in observation Struck by the spirit, Kindling of a soul Dried up, And lit.
